JANPATH, NEW DELHI 
Datrd:  4.12.2006 
 
Circular No. 27/ 2006 
 
 
Subject:- 
Reconciliation of passengers and hold  baggage and 
maintenance   of   records  by  the aircraft  operators. 
 
 
In continuation of this Bureau Circular No. 17/2004 dated 4.8.2004 and 
34/2005  dated  22.8.2005 the following instructions regarding reconciliation of 
passengers shall be strictly followed by all aircraft operators operating to/ from 
India: 
 
(i) 
The details of passenger’s boarding pass shall be entered  into the 
departure control system at the departure gate to verify that the 
passenger has arrived for boarding. 
(ii) 
In order to verify that the passenger presenting the boarding pass is 
the same person who has checked-in, a final passport and boarding 
pass check shall be conducted at the boarding gate by the aircraft 
operator, operating international flights. 
(iii) 
All aircraft operators shall ensure that when groups of individuals 
check-in, each passenger identifies his/ her  individual baggage at the 
check-in counter.  
(iv) 
Aircraft operators must  maintain  baggage reconciliation records in 
accordance with prescribed requirements and secure all official 
documentation, including baggage tags when not in use  and  hold  
baggage should be  properly secured and monitored  so that  
unauthorized persons  cannot  insert or exchange  a bag into the  
system 
 
2. 
The  above  instructions  shall be  implemented  with immediate  effect. 
 
 
 
 (M. Malaviya) 
Addl. Commissioner of  Security (CA) 
 
Distribution  as per  list  attached.
